content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-223-07-A
|Item_parent=Dyslipidemia
|Item_parent_short=Dyslipidemia
|Rank=A
|Title=Knowing the main causes of secondary hyperlipidemia
|Description=Endocrinopathies, kidney disease, liver damage, drugs
|Rubric=Etiologies
|Contributors=Laurence Duvillard, Bruno Vergès, Benjamin Bouillet, Laurence Amar, Christian Boissier, Tristan Mirault, Claire Le Hello
|Order=7}}
Main causes of secondary hyperlipidaemia :

* Endocrinopathies: hypothyroidism, hypercorticism
* Renal diseases: nephrotic syndrome, glomerulopathy
* Cholestasis
* Medications: corticoids, oestroprogestogens, retinoids, antiretrovirals, neuroleptics, mTOR inhibitors, etc.

question.title: What is a main cause of secondary hyperlipidaemia?

option_a.title: Kidney disease
option_a.description: A type of renal disease that can cause hyperlipidaemia

option_b.title: Liver damage
option_b.description: A condition that can lead to cholestasis and hyperlipidaemia

option_c.title: Hypothyroidism
option_c.description: A condition that can cause hyperlipidaemia due to metabolic changes

option_d.title: Nephrotic syndrome
option_d.description: A type of kidney disease that can cause hyperlipidaemia

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the answer
